intro: Metastelma obscurum, commonly known as the dark metastelma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
